_exec_summary.SummaryText: FIRST TIME MANAGEMENT PLAN SUBMISSION FOR THE  CITY OF MORGAN CITY WATER TREATMENT PLANT.FACILITY ID NUMBER 2694 LDEQ.THE CITY OF MORGAN CITY IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE MANAGEMENT AND EMPLOYEES OF THE WATER TREATMENT PLANT ARE COMMITED TO PROVIDING A SAFE WORK ENVIROMENT WHICH IN TURN LEADS TO SAFE OPERATIONS AT THE WATERPLANT AND PROVIDES A UNITED EFFORT TO COEXIST IN RESIDENTIAL AREAS.THE MORGAN CITY WATER PLANT IS COMITTED TO CORRECTING AREAS OF SAFTEY AND RESPONSE THAT HAVE BEEN REALIZED DURING THE COMPILATION OF INFORMATION AND DATA FOR THE RISK MANAGEMENT PLAN.A NEW EMPHASIS WILL BE PLACED ON EMERGENCY PLANNING,TRAINING AND IMPLEMENTATION.THE MORGAN CITY WATER PLANT IS A MINICIPALLY OWNED FACILITY DEDICATED TO PROVIDING SAFE DRINKING WATER TO THE PEOPLE OF MORGAN CITY AND STEPHENSVILLE AT AN AFFORDABLE COST.THE WATER PLANT IS MANDATED TO COMPLY TO THE ENVIROMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCIES SURFACE WATER TREATMENT RULE AS SET FORTHE IN THE FEDERAL REGISTER.THE ENFORCEMENT OF THESE RULES IS HANDLED BY THE LOUISIANA DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH.IN THESE RULES IS THE REQUIREMENT TO DISINFECT ALL SURFACE WATER IS PROVIDED BY THE MORGAN CITY WATER PLANT.THE WATER PLANT UTILIZES A PROCESS CALLED CHLORIMINE DISINFECTION.IN THIS PROCESS CHLORINE AND AMONIA ARE ADDED TO THE WATER AT A RATIO OF THREE TO ONE BY WEIGHT TO FORM CHLORIMINES.THIS PROCESS WAS CHOSEN TO REDUCE THE FORMATION TRIHALOMETHANES,AND WHILE A WEAKER DISINFECTANT,IT MANTAINS A LONGER RESIDUAL TROUGHOUT THE DISTRIBUTION SYSTEM.THE USE OF CHLORINE IN THIS PROCESS IS THE REASON FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF THIS RISK MANAGEMENT PLAN FOR THE MORGAN CITY WATER PLANT.THE WATER PLANT CURRENTLY HAS TWO ONE TON CHLORINE CYLINDERS ON SITE.THEY ARE CONNECTED BY AN AUTOMATIC SWITCHOVER SYSTEM TO ENSURE A CONTINUOUS FLOW FOR PROPER DISINFECTION.THE WORST CASE SCENARIO WAS CONDUCTED USING THE OCA GUIDANCE METHOD.THE RESULTS INDICATE THAT A RELEASE OR FOUR THOUSAND POUNDS OF CHLORINE COULD HAPPEN IN TEN MINUTES AT A RATE OF TWO HUNDRED TWENT

Y POUNDS PER MINUTE.THE CHLORINE COULD TRAVEL A DISTANCE OF 5.4 MILES WHICH WOULD LEAVE A RESIDUAL OF 0.0087 MG/L.THIS WAS CALCULATED WITH A WIND SPEED OF 3.4 MILES PER HOUR.IN THE UNLIKELYHOOD THAT SUCH A SCENRIO WOULD HAPPEN,THE MORGAN CITY FIRE DEPARTMENT WOULD HAVE BEEN NOTIFIED AS TO WHERE THE LEAK IS,WHAT TYPE OF CYLINDER,LIQUID OR GAS STATE,AND WHERE THE LEAK IS IN THE CHLORINE SYSTEM.{I.E. VALVE,HOLE IN CYLINDER,LEAKING GASKET} THE FIRE DEPARTMENT WILL BE APPROACHING THE LOCATION FROM THE UPWIND DIRECTION,WHILE SIMILTANEOUSLY SETTING UP AN INCIDENT COMMAND SYSTEM IN A SAFE AND SECURE LOCATION.EVACUATIONS OR SHELTER-IN-PLACE SHALL BE CALLED FOR IF NECESSARY,WHILE THE LEAK IS BEING REPAIRED OR PLUGGED.THESE PROCEDURES WILL GREATLY REDUCE THE IMPACT OF A WORST CASE SCENARIO,AND COULD ELIMINATE IT ENTIRELY.
